Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is a mistake, 4 out of 5 decks in my tournament group plays it, including myself, and I don't feel good about it, but I have to to keep up. Waaaayyyy too much value for 5 CMC with no splashing hinderances. It should have been 3green mana and 2 colourless, this is just wrong, and everybody is playing it. So good on it's own, and with restoration angel, it gets really dumb. If this keeps up, it will get banned, it would make for a more diverse metagame. It makes aggro kind of pointless to play.

Posted By: Continue (2/21/2013 9:42:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this card is much better for it's format than it is for it's card. It's an average beater with a lifegain tacked on (a nice bonus) and a small beater left over for you. It's true that flicker effects can add up on him and really flip a game, but I'm unsure that 5 life + 3/3 for a card, even if that card is cheap is that mind-bogglingly good. It's good for sure! But.. I think it has more to do with it's standard environment.   
  
JMS is brutal in \*any\* environment, and one could say the same for Baneslayer.   
  
That said, they have printed a clear response to him: [Boros Reckoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Reckoner)  
You get your choice of killing him without problem, killing him and hitting the opponent for 5 (countering the life gain) or possibly other options.   
  
I wish I could give a 4.3, I'll go with 4.5?
posts.html:

It's true that flicker effects can add up on him and really flip a game, but I'm unsure that 5 life + 3/3 for a card, even if that card is cheap is that mind-bogglingly good. It's good for sure! But.. I think it has more to do with it's standard environment.

JMS is brutal in *any* environment, and one could say the same for Baneslayer.

That said, they have printed a clear response to him: Boros Reckoner
You get your choice of killing him without problem, killing him and hitting the opponent for 5 (countering the life gain) or possibly other options.

I wish I could give a 4.3, I'll go with 4.5?

Posted By: steinburger1109 (2/13/2013 8:03:41 PM)

posts.post_content:
Thragtusk is a great card, not just because it's strong, but because when this is the defining card in standard, the format is actually in good shape.  
  
Just remember what standard looked like in previous years...  
  
Lorwyn/Alara - faeries. Imagine playing against tempo except even worse.  
Alara/Zendikar - jund. Bloodbraid elf into blightning ggwp  
Zendikar/Scars - cawblade. The first standard bannings in years, nuff said.  
Scars/Innistrad - Delver. Get bashed with 3/2 fliers for 1 mana while all your spells get mana leaked and creatures get vapor snagged.  
  
Would you rather have one of these formats, or a 5 mana creature that stalls the game out?
posts.html:

Alara/Zendikar - jund. Bloodbraid elf into blightning ggwp
Zendikar/Scars - cawblade. The first standard bannings in years, nuff said.
Scars/Innistrad - Delver. Get bashed with 3/2 fliers for 1 mana while all your spells get mana leaked and creatures get vapor snagged.

Would you rather have one of these formats, or a 5 mana creature that stalls the game out?

Posted By: BlueBodies (2/1/2013 2:43:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My only gripe about this card is that it's brainlessly good. You don't need to build around it, it's not weak to any specific deck, it doesn't clash with any type of deck, it's easily splashable, and doesn't even fully die to [doom blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doom blade).  
Hell, casting a single board wipe after this guy his the battle field is a surefire way to ruin your opponents day.  
As powerful as this card is with the current format, they really need to restrict this to a "two of" for decks. I guarantee it would make the format more diverse.
posts.html:
